org.threadly.util

Class ArgumentVerifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.util.ArgumentVerifier

  • public class ArgumentVerifier
extends java.lang.Object

    Simple class to do some argument verifying which is common within threadly. This is designed to primarily reduce bulk/repeated code throughout the base, as well as to ensure that thrown exceptions have a common format for the exception message.

    Since:
    2.4.0

      • assertNotNull

        public static void assertNotNull(java.lang.Object arg,
                                 java.lang.String name)
        Verifies the provided argument is not null, if it is an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        arg - Object to check against to not be null
        name - Name to provide the argument in the message of the thrown exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the arg is null

      • assertNotNegative

        public static void assertNotNegative(double val,
                                     java.lang.String name)
        Verifies the provided argument is not negative (zero is okay). If it is less than zero an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        val - Value to verify against
        name - Name to provide the argument in the message of the thrown exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if value is less than zero

      • assertGreaterThanZero

        public static void assertGreaterThanZero(double val,
                                         java.lang.String name)
        Verifies the provided argument is greater than zero. If it is less than one an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        val - Value to verify against
        name - Name to provide the argument in the message of the thrown exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if value is less than one

      • assertLessThan

        public static void assertLessThan(double val,
                                  double compareVal,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Verifies the provided argument is less than the compare value. If it is greater than or equal to the compare value an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        val - Value to verify
        compareVal - value to compare against
        name - Name to provide the argument in the message of the thrown exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if value is greather than or equal to compareVal
